poem:
"Refuge Amid Rebellion"

An innocent flutter of newsprint
stains the morning's tranquil light.
Rwanda whispers in political schemes,
her children in flight.

Revolt ripples in the ranks of the Tories,
The UN's warning falls flat as a dial tone.
Sunak's spat with law, quite the story,
His own voters wish asylum-seekers gone.

In the chaos, the invisible plea, 
"Who will harbour the disowned?"
